key_points: President Biden's COVID-19 strategy has led to 300 million vaccine doses administered in 150 days, significantly lowering COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths.
When Biden took office, only 5% of adult Americans were vaccinated, with a slow initial pace of vaccinations.
More than 175 million Americans have now received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose.
65% of adult Americans have gotten at least one shot, and 55% are fully vaccinated.
The administration's efforts included securing vaccine supply, increasing vaccination sites, and mobilizing federal personnel for vaccinations.
Over 81,000 vaccination sites have been established, making it easier for Americans to get vaccinated within 5 miles of where they live.
The federal pharmacy vaccination program expanded to 42,000 local pharmacies, administering over 82 million shots.
39 federally-run, high-volume vaccination sites were set up, particularly in vulnerable neighborhoods.
Community health centers played a significant role, especially for the poverty-line population and racial/ethnic minorities, hosting almost 11,000 pop-up clinics.
The Biden Administration has emphasized equity, with a majority of federally-provided shots going to people of color and support for over 20,000 community-based pop-up vaccination clinics.
